meanings.definition: In a manner that spreads from one person or thing to another
meanings.sent1: The laughter spread contagiously throughout the room.
meanings.sent2: The yawn passed contagiously from one student to another in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The happiness seemed to hop contagiously from person to person.
meanings.sent4: Her positive energy was contagiously infectious, lighting up the whole office.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was contagiously palpable, making everyone smile.

meanings.definition: In a way that is likely to spread or affect others
meanings.sent1: The gossip about the new student spread contagiously among the classmates.
meanings.sent2: The flu virus can be transmitted contagiously through close contact.
meanings.sent3: The news of the surprise party traveled contagiously through the group of friends.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was contagiously inspiring, motivating the team.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was contagiously thick, making everyone uneasy.
